text:
Message 1664 of 4024
By the way, it really hurt my feelings that you said I took everything. That makes me feel really bad. And I had hoped we would discuss it with the kids
before it looked like I was stealing all the Kirkland stuff. You and I had agreed on the list to be sure it was fair.
I think I took the couch and two chairs . I think you kept all the other big furniture in the whole house. I also took the bed at your suggestion, but
gave you the beach bed. Then I took the outdoor furniture that you don’t use at all, no one does. And I got a bunch of junk from the beach but
offered it to you first.
I thought that was consistent with what we had agreed to. I was in no way trying to screw you at all. I thought we did some edits and updates by
swapping things back-and-forth like the bed and the TV in the spirit of cooperation. I thought it was fair.
Then I purchased a pit group from Amazon that was cheap and everything else has been consignment shopping or craigslist. I don’t like the image
that I have just stolen everything against your wishes.
Please let me know how we can resolve that situation if you feel like I’ve done something unfair. But also, please remember that dad‘s house is the boys
house too. We just don’t have a parenting plan in place.
What do you want back?
-robert
Sent:02/26/2024 at 06:34 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/26/2024 at 08:02 PM)
Subject:Taking all our stuff
Message 1665 of 4024
You asked to take the table and guest bedroom  so I would have been left with the big couch and coffee table and kids and I bed.
You took the tvs off the walls and gave me two tvs that didn’t even work or fit in the brackets.
Im keeping this short at Dr Brown advice and don’t care to go back and forth.
Sent:02/26/2024 at 08:06 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/26/2024 at 09:32 PM)
Subject:Re: Taking all our stuff
Message 1666 of 4024
Example of you getting upset at me when you gestured I come down, visibly frustrated then telling me to come down.
It’s not even like I have a reason or choice, just straight into do it my way or I will get annoyed and angry.
There is a reason I prefer not to.
Sent:02/26/2024 at 08:07 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 02/26/2024 at 09:32 PM)
Subject:Re: What are you doing?
